review: I am new to video streaming (having just shut off my cable), and I added in NetFlix and Hulu along with Amazon Prime to give me a lot of options for a fraction of the price. The Netflix interface has *a lot* to be desired, so I'm hoping that will improve over time. Overall, nice interface for all the other content I've been using and easy to use. I thought the voice search feature would be more of a gimmick, but I find I use it all the time and it works perfect for a great user experience.

review: I bought this and a Roku 3 at the same time.  The Amazon Fire TV is a better device....BUT, it is Limited on Content.  We have all our purchased movies on VUDU and Amazon does not support or offer any way to connect to VUDU.  There are a number of other movie and channel apps that Amazon does not support.If Amazon offered the same connectivity it would be the best....but for now, I use the ROKU 3 most of the time while my Amazon fire tv collects dust waiting until Amazon wakes up and expands its offerings.Amazon also tries to direct you to buy shows to watch even if they are free to Prime users.  You have to be very cautious to not accidentally buy movies that you can get for free.  The voice search is cool, but again, it only works on Amazon content and does not expand to any other apps such as Netflix or Hulu.  So again, be careful to not buy a movie that is free in another app.
